1: Unless Yahweh builds a house, its builders labor at it in vain. Unless Yahweh guards a city, a guard watches in vain.
2: It is in vain for you who rise early and sit late, eating the bread of anxious toil, when thus he[b] provides[c] for his beloved in his sleep.[d]
3: Look, children[e] are the heritage[f] of Yahweh; the fruit of the womb is a reward.
4: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are the children[g] of one's youth.
5: Blessed is the man who fills his quiver with them.[h] They shall not be put to shame when they speak with enemies at the gate.
